title: Rocket Report: European rocket reuse test delayed; NASA tweaks SLS for Artemis II
summary: "There’s a lot of interest because of the fear that there’s just not a lot of capacity."
detailed_news: Rocket Lab plans to raise up to $750 million by selling common shares. Astra targets mid-2026 for the first flight of its Rocket 4 vehicle. Avio's board of directors approves a 400 million euro ($471 million) capital increase. It is still subject to a shareholder vote, scheduled for October 23. Isar Aerospace executives discuss the outcome of the investigation into the March 30 launch of the Spectrum rocket. Despite the failure to get to orbit, Isar considers the first Spectrum launch a successful test flight. The company is working toward a second flight of Spectrum, which will take place "as soon as possible" Northrop Grumman inked a contract with SpaceX for three Falcon 9 launches. Launch companies are reiterating plans to sharply increase flight rates. United Launch Alliance projected 20 launches in 2025 between the Atlas 5 and Vulcan Centaur. Arianespace projected five Ariane 6 launches this year, including the debut of the more powerful Ariane 64, with four solid-rocket boosters. Ars is a trusted source in a sea of information. You don’t need to know everything, only what’s important. With our unique combination of technical savvy and wide-ranging interest in the technological arts and sciences, we can help you understand the world around you.

title: Hubble Images Celestial Cigar’s Smoldering Heart
summary: This NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image reveals new details in Messier 82 (M82), home to brilliant stars whose light is shaded by sculptural clouds made of clumps and streaks of dust and gas. This image features the star-powered heart of the galaxy, located just 12 million light-years away in the constellation Ursa Major (the Great […]
detailed_news: Messier 82 (M82) is 12 million light-years away in the constellation Ursa Major (the Great Bear) The galaxy forms stars 10 times faster than the Milky Way. The intense starbirth period that grips this galaxy gave rise to super star clusters in the galaxy’s heart.

title: Taiwanese aerospace firm partners with Maxar on GPS-alternative drone navigation
summary:
The satellite imagery company’s Raptor software uses terrain mapping to guide UAVs when satellite signals are jammed or unavailable
The post Taiwanese aerospace firm partners with Maxar on GPS-alternative drone navigation appeared first on SpaceNews.
detailed_news: Maxar Intelligence announced a deal with one of Taiwan’s largest aerospace and defense contractors. Maxar Raptor is a vision-based software suite that enables autonomous drones to navigate. It provides a terrain-based positioning system for drones in GPS-denied environments. The partnership comes as military and civilian aircraft operators worldwide grapple with GPS jamming. Enter the code we sent to , or clicking the magic link in the email. title: 85 new subglacial lakes detected below Antarctica
summary: Hidden beneath the biggest ice mass on Earth, hundreds of subglacial lakes form a crucial part of Antarctica’s icy structure, affecting the movement and stability of glaciers, and consequentially influencing global sea level rise.
detailed_news: Hundreds of subglacial lakes form a crucial part of Antarctica’s icy structure, affecting the movement and stability of glaciers. Researchers have identified 85 previously unknown lakes several kilometres under the frozen surface surrounding the South Pole. The research also identified new drainage pathways underneath the ice sheet. This increases the number of known active sub glacial lakes below Antarctica by more than half. The biggest known subglacial lake is Lake Vostok underneath the East Antarctic Ice Sheet, holding an estimated 5000–65 000 cubic km of water. By monitoring such phenomena, scientists can improve their understanding of interactions between the ice sheet, bedrock, ocean and atmosphere. “Subglacial hydrology is a missing piece in many ice sheet models,” said Sally.

title: Earth from Space: Komodo Island, Indonesia
summary: From the ESA Blogs.
detailed_news: Komodo is part of the Indonesian Lesser Sunda Islands and lies on the Sape Strait between the larger islands of Flores to the east and Sumbawa to the west. The island is of volcanic origin and, as visible in the image, its terrain is generally rugged, with sparse vegetation, featuring rounded hills that reach a maximum elevation of 825 m. The turquoise colour in the water along the coasts and around the surrounding islets reveal the presence of shallow waters and coral reefs.

title: Themis stands on the launch pad
summary: From the ESA Blogs.
detailed_news: Themis is the first European demonstration of a full-scale vertical take-off and landing rocket element that uses cryogenic propulsion. Themis uses the Prometheus engine, almost as powerful as the Ariane 6 rocket’s main engine. Prometheus can restart in flight and throttle its thrust to ensure a soft and safe landing.

title: Space Cargo Unlimited Secures €27.5M for BentoBox Payload Platform
summary:
In-space logistics provider Space Cargo Unlimited has closed a €27.5 million Series A funding round to continue the development of its BentoBox payload platform. In late 2022, Space Cargo Unlimited partnered with Thales Alenia Space to develop a returnable space platform called REV-1, which is designed to support in-orbit manufacturing and microgravity experimentation. Alongside REV-1, […]
The post Space Cargo Unlimited Secures €27.5M for BentoBox Payload Platform appeared first on European Spaceflight.
detailed_news: In-space logistics provider Space Cargo Unlimited has closed a €27.5 million Series A funding round to continue the development of its BentoBox payload platform. The company will initially offer it as a stand alone offering flown aboard an ATMOS Space Cargo Phoenix return capsule that is equipped with an inflatable heatshield to survive re-entry. An initial flight of the Bentobox payload platform is expected to take place in the second quarter of 2026.

title: Space Norway and SSTL collaborate on radar satellite program
summary:
Space Norway and Surrey Satellite Technology Ltd. (SSTL) are working together on a radar satellite for maritime domain awareness, the first of potentially several such spacecraft.
The post Space Norway and SSTL collaborate on radar satellite program appeared first on SpaceNews.
detailed_news: Space Norway and Surrey Satellite Technology Ltd. are working together on a radar satellite. The 400-kilogram satellite is scheduled to launch in early 2027 on a SpaceX rideshare mission. The focus of the satellite will be to monitor the North Atlantic region. The satellite is the first in a proposed constellation of six satellites.

title: XRISM uncovers a mystery in the cosmic winds of change
summary: The X-Ray Imaging and Spectroscopy Mission (XRISM) has revealed an unexpected difference between the powerful winds launching from a disc around a neutron star and those from material circling supermassive black holes. The surprisingly dense wind blowing from the stellar system challenges our understanding of how such winds form and drive change in their surroundings.
